Question
========
For his thesis research, a graduate student measured the degree of self-confidence of students measured with a scale consisting of 6 items and ranging from 1 (low self-confidence) to 10 (high self-confidence). The Cronbach's alpha of this scale is 0.78.  
  
The Cronbach's alpha could be increased by...

Answerlist
----------
* Including additional respondents in the study (increasing N).
* Using a z-score of 1.96 as the critical limit, instead of 2.
* To remove an item with a high positive "Corrected item-total correlation." remove.
* To remove an item with a value of 0.82 at "Cronbach's alpha if item deleted." delete.
